contentrichtext.text: {{Unreferenced|date=November 2011}} <!-- {{Pathnav|Japan|Kantō Region|Saitama Prefecture|frame=1}} [[Image:Saitama_kitasaitama_district.PNG|frame|北埼玉郡の範囲]] --> {{nihongo|'''Kita-Saitama District'''|北埼玉郡|Kita-Saitama-gun}} was a [[districts of Japan|district]] located in [[Saitama Prefecture]]. Prior to its abolition, Kita-Saitama District had three towns: *[[Kisai, Saitama|Town of Kisai]] (騎西町; Kisai-machi) *[[Kitakawabe, Saitama|Town of Kitakawabe]] (北川辺町; Kitakawabe-machi) *[[Ōtone, Saitama|Town of Ōtone]] (大利根町; Ōtone-machi) On March 23, 2010, all 3 towns merged with the [[Kazo, Saitama|city of Kazo]] to newly create the city of Kazo and the district dissolved. As a result, it was the first district to dissolve within Saitama Prefecture since the districts were reorganized in 1896. ==Timeline== *January 1, 1971 - The village of Ōtone becomes the '''[[Ōtone, Saitama|town of Ōtone]]'''.(2 towns, 3 village) *April 1, 1971 - The village of Kitakawabe becomes the '''[[Kitakawabe, Saitama|town of Kitakawabe]]'''.(3 towns, 2 village) *May 1, 2001 - The village of Kawasato becomes the '''[[Kawasato, Saitama|town of Kawasato]]'''.(4 towns, 1 village) *October 1, 2005 - The [[Kawasato, Saitama|town of Kawasato]] merged into the [[Kōnosu, Saitama|city of Kōnosu]].(3 towns, 1 village) *January 1, 2006 - The [[Minamikawara, Saitama|village of Minamikawara]] merged into the [[Gyōda, Saitama|city of Gyōda]].(3 towns) *March 23, 2010 - The towns of Kisai, Kitakawabe, and Ōtone merged with the city of Kazo to newly form the '''city of Kazo'''. Kita-Saitama District was dissolved the same day. == References == {{reflist}} == See also == * [[Saitama District, Musashi]] * [[Minami-Saitama District, Saitama]] * [[List of dissolved districts of Japan]] {{coord|36|07|53|N|139|36|06|E|type:landmark_source:itwiki|display=title}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Kitasaitama District}} [[Category:Former districts of Saitama Prefecture]] {{Saitama-geo-stub}}
